# Generate CI's
```{r, cache = TRUE}
# change hive to factor
sl$hive = as.factor(sl$hive)
m2 = lmer(freq ~ trt2 + hive + trialNum +  (1+trialNum|colNum), data = sl)
summary(m2)


# using hive 5, since it's the one with the most data
pframe <- data.frame(trt2 = levels(droplevels(sl$trt2)), hive = factor(5, levels = levels(sl$hive)),  colNum = 99999, trialNum = 2)
pframe$freq <- 0
pp <- predict(m2, newdata = pframe, re.form=NA, type = 'response') # re.form sets all random effects to 0


### Calculate CI's (using bootstrap, not accounting for random effects)
bb2 <- bootMer(m2, FUN=function(x) predict(x, pframe, re.form=NA, type = 'response'), nsim = 1000)
bb2_se <-apply(bb2$t,2,function(x) quantile(x, probs = c(0.025, 0.975)))
pframe$blo<-bb2_se[1,]
pframe$bhi<-bb2_se[2,]
pframe$predMean <- pp
pframe <- pframe[, c('trt2', "blo", "bhi", "predMean")]
```
